positive.translation[0].definitions[0].d: if you are positive about things, you are hopeful and confident, and think about what is good in a situation rather than what is bad
positive.translation[0].definitions[0].e: She’s got a really positive attitude to life.
You’ve got to be more positive about your work.
positive.translation[0].definitions[1].e: At least something positive has come out of the situation.
Write down all the positive things about your life.
The rural environment was having a positive effect on the children’s health.
It’s been a very positive experience for her.
TV can be a positive influence.
the positive contribution to the community made by many older people
It’s been a difficult time but, on the positive side, I feel physically fine.
Women should be portrayed in a more positive light.
positive.translation[0].definitions[2].d: if you take positive action, you do something definite in order to try to achieve something
positive.translation[0].definitions[2].e: We need to take positive steps to improve the situation of families in poverty.
It’s a relief to know that something positive is being done.
positive.translation[0].definitions[3].e: We’ve had a lot of positive feedback from the people of this city.
The response we’ve had from the public has been very positive.
Most people have been very positive about the show.
positive.translation[0].definitions[4].d: very sure, with no doubt at all that something is right or true
positive.translation[0].definitions[4].e: Are you absolutely positive you locked the door?
positive.translation[0].definitions[5].d: showing that something is likely to succeed or improve
positive.translation[0].definitions[5].e: The fact that he’s breathing on his own again is a positive sign.
positive.translation[0].definitions[6].d: showing signs of the medical condition or chemical that is being looked for
positive.translation[0].definitions[6].e: The test results came back positive.
athletes who had tested positive for banned substances
positive.translation[0].definitions[7].d: used to emphasize how good or bad something is
positive.translation[0].definitions[7].e: The journey was a positive nightmare.
positive.translation[0].definitions[8].d: a positive number is more than zero
positive.translation[0].definitions[9].d: having the type of electrical charge that is carried by protons
positive.translation[0].note_box[0].head: – Meaning 1: if you are positive about things, you are hopeful and confident, and think about what is good in a situation rather than what is bad
positive.translation[0].note_box[0].sect: Having a positive attitude makes life so much better.
This is just the positive approach that the school needs.
He takes a fairly positive view of the future.
Many people believe that positive thinking can help your recovery from serious illnesses.
positive.translation[0].note_box[1].head: – Meaning 2: good or useful
positive.translation[0].note_box[1].sect: a positive thing
That's not a very positive thing to say.
a positive aspect
There are a lot of positive aspects to retirement.
a positive effect/impact
Exercise has a positive effect on health.
a positive influence
His mother was a strong positive influence.
a positive contribution
Most refugees are determined to make a positive contribution to their new country.
a positive result/outcome
We hope there will be a positive outcome to the talks.
a positive experience
Working here has been a very positive experience for me.
a positive role model
We should provide girls with more positive role models.
a positive image
It's important to promote a positive image of our industry to young people.
see/present something in a positive light
If you spend a year travelling after school, employers often see this in a positive light.
The merger was presented to the world in a positive light.
on the positive side
On the positive side, the company’s financial condition remains strong.
positive.translation[1].definitions[0].d: a quality or feature that is good or useful
positive.translation[1].definitions[0].e: You can find positives in any situation.
positive.translation[2].definitions[0].e: When interest rates fall, there is a positive effect on business confidence.
He felt that these meetings did not make any sort of positive contribution to branch performance.
positive.translation[2].definitions[1].e: The response we’ve had from our customers has been very positive.
positive.translation[2].definitions[2].d: thinking that a situation is good or will be good
positive.translation[2].definitions[2].e: The company is very positive about its future.
positive.translation[2].definitions[3].d: if you take positive action, you do something definite in order to try and achieve something
positive.translation[2].definitions[3].e: She took positive steps to boost her design team.
positive.translation[2].definitions[4].e: Exports totaled $1,275 million, while imports totaled $1,050 million, giving a positive trade balance of $225 million.
